verses.text: Blessed is the man who doesn’t walk in the counsel of the wicked,
but his delight is in the LORD’s law.
He will be like a tree planted by the streams of water,
The wicked are not so,
Therefore the wicked shall not stand in the judgement,
For the LORD knows the way of the righteous,
Why do the nations rage,
The kings of the earth take a stand,
“Let’s break their bonds apart,
He who sits in the heavens will laugh.
Then he will speak to them in his anger,
“Yet I have set my King on my holy hill of Zion.”
I will tell of the decree:
Ask of me, and I will give the nations for your inheritance,
You shall break them with a rod of iron.
Now therefore be wise, you kings.
Serve the LORD with fear,
Give sincere homage to the Son, lest he be angry, and you perish on the way,
LORD, how my adversaries have increased!
Many there are who say of my soul,
But you, LORD, are a shield around me,
I cry to the LORD with my voice,
I laid myself down and slept.
I will not be afraid of tens of thousands of people
Arise, LORD!
Salvation belongs to the LORD.

chapters.superscription: A Psalm by David, when he fled from Absalom his son.

verses.text: Answer me when I call, God of my righteousness.
You sons of men, how long shall my glory be turned into dishonour?
But know that the LORD has set apart for himself him who is godly;
Stand in awe, and don’t sin.
Offer the sacrifices of righteousness.
Many say, “Who will show us any good?”
You have put gladness in my heart,
In peace I will both lay myself down and sleep,

chapters.superscription: For the Chief Musician; on stringed instruments. A Psalm by David.

verses.text: Give ear to my words, LORD.
Listen to the voice of my cry, my King and my God,
LORD, in the morning you will hear my voice.
For you are not a God who has pleasure in wickedness.
The arrogant will not stand in your sight.
You will destroy those who speak lies.
But as for me, in the abundance of your loving kindness I will come into your house.
Lead me, LORD, in your righteousness because of my enemies.
For there is no faithfulness in their mouth.
Hold them guilty, God.
But let all those who take refuge in you rejoice.
For you will bless the righteous.

chapters.superscription: For the Chief Musician, with the flutes. A Psalm by David.

verses.text: LORD, don’t rebuke me in your anger,
Have mercy on me, LORD, for I am faint.
My soul is also in great anguish.
Return, LORD. Deliver my soul,
For in death there is no memory of you.
I am weary with my groaning.
My eye wastes away because of grief.
Depart from me, all you workers of iniquity,
The LORD has heard my supplication.
May all my enemies be ashamed and dismayed.

chapters.superscription: For the Chief Musician; on stringed instruments, upon the eight-stringed lyre. A Psalm by David.

verses.text: LORD, my God, I take refuge in you.
lest they tear apart my soul like a lion,
LORD, my God, if I have done this,
if I have rewarded evil to him who was at peace with me
let the enemy pursue my soul, and overtake it;
Arise, LORD, in your anger.
Let the congregation of the peoples surround you.
The LORD administers judgement to the peoples.
Oh let the wickedness of the wicked come to an end,
My shield is with God,
God is a righteous judge,
If a man doesn’t repent, he will sharpen his sword;
He has also prepared for himself the instruments of death.
Behold, he travails with iniquity.
He has dug a hole,
The trouble he causes shall return to his own head.
I will give thanks to the LORD according to his righteousness,

chapters.superscription: A meditation by David, which he sang to the LORD, concerning the words of Cush, the Benjamite.

verses.text: LORD, our Lord, how majestic is your name in all the earth!
From the lips of babes and infants you have established strength,
When I consider your heavens, the work of your fingers,
what is man, that you think of him?
For you have made him a little lower than the angels,
You make him ruler over the works of your hands.
All sheep and cattle,
the birds of the sky, the fish of the sea,
LORD, our Lord,

chapters.superscription: For the Chief Musician; on an instrument of Gath. A Psalm by David.

verses.text: I will give thanks to the LORD with my whole heart.
I will be glad and rejoice in you.
When my enemies turn back,
For you have maintained my just cause.
You have rebuked the nations.
The enemy is overtaken by endless ruin.
But the LORD reigns forever.
He will judge the world in righteousness.
The LORD will also be a high tower for the oppressed;
Those who know your name will put their trust in you,
Sing praises to the LORD, who dwells in Zion,
For he who avenges blood remembers them.
Have mercy on me, LORD.
that I may show all of your praise.
The nations have sunk down in the pit that they made.
The LORD has made himself known.
The wicked shall be turned back to Sheol,
For the needy shall not always be forgotten,
Arise, LORD! Don’t let man prevail.
Put them in fear, LORD.

chapters.superscription: For the Chief Musician. Set to “The Death of the Son.” A Psalm by David.

verses.text: Why do you stand far off, LORD?
In arrogance, the wicked hunt down the weak.
For the wicked boasts of his heart’s cravings.
The wicked, in the pride of his face,
His ways are prosperous at all times.
He says in his heart, “I shall not be shaken.
His mouth is full of cursing, deceit, and oppression.
He lies in wait near the villages.
He lurks in secret as a lion in his ambush.
The helpless are crushed.
He says in his heart, “God has forgotten.
Arise, LORD!
Why does the wicked person condemn God,
But you do see trouble and grief.
Break the arm of the wicked.
The LORD is King forever and ever!
LORD, you have heard the desire of the humble.
to judge the fatherless and the oppressed,
In the LORD, I take refuge.
For, behold, the wicked bend their bows.
If the foundations are destroyed,
The LORD is in his holy temple.
The LORD examines the righteous,
On the wicked he will rain blazing coals;
For the LORD is righteous.

chapters.superscription: For the Chief Musician. By David.

verses.text: Help, LORD; for the godly man ceases.
Everyone lies to his neighbour.
May the LORD cut off all flattering lips,
who have said, “With our tongue we will prevail.
“Because of the oppression of the weak and because of the groaning of the needy,
The LORD’s words are flawless words,
You will keep them, LORD.
The wicked walk on every side,

chapters.superscription: For the Chief Musician; upon an eight-stringed lyre. A Psalm of David.

verses.text: How long, LORD?
How long shall I take counsel in my soul,
Behold, and answer me, LORD, my God.
lest my enemy say, “I have prevailed against him;”
But I trust in your loving kindness.
I will sing to the LORD,

chapters.superscription: For the Chief Musician. A Psalm by David.

verses.text: The fool has said in his heart, “There is no God.”
The LORD looked down from heaven on the children of men,
They have all gone aside.
Have all the workers of iniquity no knowledge,
There they were in great fear,
You frustrate the plan of the poor,
Oh that the salvation of Israel would come out of Zion!

chapters.superscription: For the Chief Musician. By David.

verses.text: LORD, who shall dwell in your sanctuary?
He who walks blamelessly and does what is right,
he who doesn’t slander with his tongue,
in whose eyes a vile man is despised,
he who doesn’t lend out his money for usury,

chapters.superscription: A Psalm by David.

verses.text: Preserve me, God, for I take refuge in you.
My soul, you have said to the LORD, “You are my Lord.
As for the saints who are in the earth,
Their sorrows shall be multiplied who give gifts to another god.
The LORD assigned my portion and my cup.
The lines have fallen to me in pleasant places.
I will bless the LORD, who has given me counsel.
I have set the LORD always before me.
Therefore my heart is glad, and my tongue rejoices.
For you will not leave my soul in Sheol,
You will show me the path of life.

chapters.superscription: A Poem by David.

verses.text: Hear, LORD, my righteous plea.
Let my sentence come out of your presence.
You have proved my heart.
As for the deeds of men, by the word of your lips,
My steps have held fast to your paths.
I have called on you, for you will answer me, God.
Show your marvellous loving kindness,
Keep me as the apple of your eye.
from the wicked who oppress me,
They close up their callous hearts.
They have now surrounded us in our steps.
He is like a lion that is greedy of his prey,
Arise, LORD, confront him.
from men by your hand, LORD,
As for me, I shall see your face in righteousness.

chapters.superscription: A Prayer by David.

verses.text: I love you, LORD, my strength.
The LORD is my rock, my fortress, and my deliverer;
I call on the LORD, who is worthy to be praised;
The cords of death surrounded me.
The cords of Sheol were around me.
In my distress I called on the LORD,
Then the earth shook and trembled.
Smoke went out of his nostrils.
He bowed the heavens also, and came down.
He rode on a cherub, and flew.
He made darkness his hiding place, his pavilion around him,
At the brightness before him his thick clouds passed,
The LORD also thundered in the sky.
He sent out his arrows, and scattered them.
Then the channels of waters appeared.
He sent from on high.
He delivered me from my strong enemy,
They came on me in the day of my calamity,
He brought me out also into a large place.
The LORD has rewarded me according to my righteousness.
For I have kept the ways of the LORD,
For all his ordinances were before me.
I was also blameless with him.
Therefore the LORD has rewarded me according to my righteousness,
With the merciful you will show yourself merciful.
With the pure, you will show yourself pure.
For you will save the afflicted people,
For you will light my lamp, LORD.
For by you, I advance through a troop.
As for God, his way is perfect.
For who is God, except the LORD?
the God who arms me with strength, and makes my way perfect?
He makes my feet like deer’s feet,
He teaches my hands to war,
You have also given me the shield of your salvation.
You have enlarged my steps under me,
I will pursue my enemies, and overtake them.
I will strike them through, so that they will not be able to rise.
For you have armed me with strength to the battle.
You have also made my enemies turn their backs to me,
They cried, but there was no one to save;
Then I beat them small as the dust before the wind.
You have delivered me from the strivings of the people.
As soon as they hear of me they shall obey me.
The foreigners shall fade away,
The LORD lives! Blessed be my rock.
even the God who executes vengeance for me,
He rescues me from my enemies.
Therefore I will give thanks to you, LORD, amongst the nations,
He gives great deliverance to his king,

chapters.superscription: For the Chief Musician. By David the servant of the LORD, who spoke to the LORD the words of this song in the day that the LORD delivered him from the hand of all his enemies, and from the hand of Saul. He said,

verses.text: The heavens declare the glory of God.
Day after day they pour out speech,
There is no speech nor language
Their voice has gone out through all the earth,
which is as a bridegroom coming out of his room,
His going out is from the end of the heavens,
The LORD’s law is perfect, restoring the soul.
The LORD’s precepts are right, rejoicing the heart.
The fear of the LORD is clean, enduring forever.
They are more to be desired than gold, yes, than much fine gold,
Moreover your servant is warned by them.
Who can discern his errors?
Keep back your servant also from presumptuous sins.
Let the words of my mouth and the meditation of my heart

chapters.superscription: For the Chief Musician. A Psalm by David.

verses.text: May the LORD answer you in the day of trouble.
send you help from the sanctuary,
remember all your offerings,
May he grant you your heart’s desire,
We will triumph in your salvation.
Now I know that the LORD saves his anointed.
Some trust in chariots, and some in horses,
They are bowed down and fallen,
Save, LORD!

chapters.superscription: For the Chief Musician. A Psalm by David.

verses.text: The king rejoices in your strength, LORD!
You have given him his heart’s desire,
For you meet him with the blessings of goodness.
He asked life of you and you gave it to him,
His glory is great in your salvation.
For you make him most blessed forever.
For the king trusts in the LORD.
Your hand will find out all of your enemies.
You will make them as a fiery furnace in the time of your anger.
You will destroy their descendants from the earth,
For they intended evil against you.
For you will make them turn their back,
Be exalted, LORD, in your strength,

chapters.superscription: For the Chief Musician. A Psalm by David.

verses.text: My God, my God, why have you forsaken me?
My God, I cry in the daytime, but you don’t answer;
But you are holy,
Our fathers trusted in you.
They cried to you, and were delivered.
But I am a worm, and no man;
All those who see me mock me.
“He trusts in the LORD.
But you brought me out of the womb.
I was thrown on you from my mother’s womb.
Don’t be far from me, for trouble is near.
Many bulls have surrounded me.
They open their mouths wide against me,
I am poured out like water.
My strength is dried up like a potsherd.
For dogs have surrounded me.
I can count all of my bones.
They divide my garments amongst them.
But don’t be far off, LORD.
Deliver my soul from the sword,
Save me from the lion’s mouth!
I will declare your name to my brothers.
You who fear the LORD, praise him!
For he has not despised nor abhorred the affliction of the afflicted,
My praise of you comes in the great assembly.
The humble shall eat and be satisfied.
All the ends of the earth shall remember and turn to the LORD.
For the kingdom is the LORD’s.
All the rich ones of the earth shall eat and worship.
Posterity shall serve him.
They shall come and shall declare his righteousness to a people that shall be born,

chapters.superscription: For the Chief Musician; set to “The Doe of the Morning.” A Psalm by David.

verses.text: The LORD is my shepherd;
He makes me lie down in green pastures.
He restores my soul.
Even though I walk through the valley of the shadow of death,
You prepare a table before me
Surely goodness and loving kindness shall follow me all the days of my life,

chapters.superscription: A Psalm by David.

verses.text: The earth is the LORD’s, with its fullness;
For he has founded it on the seas,
Who may ascend to the LORD’s hill?
He who has clean hands and a pure heart;
He shall receive a blessing from the LORD,
This is the generation of those who seek Him,
Lift up your heads, you gates!
Who is the King of glory?
Lift up your heads, you gates;
Who is this King of glory?

chapters.superscription: A Psalm by David.

verses.text: To you, LORD, I lift up my soul.
My God, I have trusted in you.
Yes, no one who waits for you will be shamed.
Show me your ways, LORD.
Guide me in your truth, and teach me,
LORD, remember your tender mercies and your loving kindness,
Don’t remember the sins of my youth, nor my transgressions.
Good and upright is the LORD,
He will guide the humble in justice.
All the paths of the LORD are loving kindness and truth
For your name’s sake, LORD,
What man is he who fears the LORD?
His soul will dwell at ease.
The friendship of the LORD is with those who fear him.
My eyes are ever on the LORD,
Turn to me, and have mercy on me,
The troubles of my heart are enlarged.
Consider my affliction and my travail.
Consider my enemies, for they are many.
Oh keep my soul, and deliver me.
Let integrity and uprightness preserve me,
God, redeem Israel

chapters.superscription: By David.

verses.text: Judge me, LORD, for I have walked in my integrity.
Examine me, LORD, and prove me.
For your loving kindness is before my eyes.
I have not sat with deceitful men,
I hate the assembly of evildoers,
I will wash my hands in innocence,
that I may make the voice of thanksgiving to be heard
LORD, I love the habitation of your house,
Don’t gather my soul with sinners,
in whose hands is wickedness;
But as for me, I will walk in my integrity.
My foot stands in an even place.

chapters.superscription: By David.

verses.text: The LORD is my light and my salvation.
When evildoers came at me to eat up my flesh,
Though an army should encamp against me,
One thing I have asked of the LORD, that I will seek after:
For in the day of trouble, he will keep me secretly in his pavilion.
Now my head will be lifted up above my enemies around me.
Hear, LORD, when I cry with my voice.
When you said, “Seek my face,”
Don’t hide your face from me.
When my father and my mother forsake me,
Teach me your way, LORD.
Don’t deliver me over to the desire of my adversaries,
I am still confident of this:
Wait for the LORD.

chapters.superscription: By David.

verses.text: To you, LORD, I call.
Hear the voice of my petitions, when I cry to you,
Don’t draw me away with the wicked,
Give them according to their work, and according to the wickedness of their doings.
Because they don’t respect the works of the LORD,
Blessed be the LORD,
The LORD is my strength and my shield.
The LORD is their strength.
Save your people,

chapters.superscription: By David.

verses.text: Ascribe to the LORD, you sons of the mighty,
Ascribe to the LORD the glory due to his name.
The LORD’s voice is on the waters.
The LORD’s voice is powerful.
The LORD’s voice breaks the cedars.
He makes them also to skip like a calf;
The LORD’s voice strikes with flashes of lightning.
The LORD’s voice shakes the wilderness.
The LORD’s voice makes the deer calve,
The LORD sat enthroned at the Flood.
The LORD will give strength to his people.

chapters.superscription: A Psalm by David.

verses.text: I will extol you, LORD, for you have raised me up,
LORD my God, I cried to you,
LORD, you have brought up my soul from Sheol.
Sing praise to the LORD, you saints of his.
For his anger is but for a moment.
As for me, I said in my prosperity,
You, LORD, when you favoured me, made my mountain stand strong;
I cried to you, LORD.
“What profit is there in my destruction, if I go down to the pit?
Hear, LORD, and have mercy on me.
You have turned my mourning into dancing for me.
to the end that my heart may sing praise to you, and not be silent.

chapters.superscription: A Psalm. A Song for the Dedication of the Temple. By David.

verses.text: In you, LORD, I take refuge.
Bow down your ear to me.
For you are my rock and my fortress,
Pluck me out of the net that they have laid secretly for me,
Into your hand I commend my spirit.
I hate those who regard lying vanities,
I will be glad and rejoice in your loving kindness,
You have not shut me up into the hand of the enemy.
Have mercy on me, LORD, for I am in distress.
For my life is spent with sorrow,
Because of all my adversaries I have become utterly contemptible to my neighbours,
I am forgotten from their hearts like a dead man.
For I have heard the slander of many, terror on every side,
But I trust in you, LORD.
My times are in your hand.
Make your face to shine on your servant.
Let me not be disappointed, LORD, for I have called on you.
Let the lying lips be mute,
Oh how great is your goodness,
In the shelter of your presence you will hide them from the plotting of man.
Praise be to the LORD,
As for me, I said in my haste, “I am cut off from before your eyes.”
Oh love the LORD, all you his saints!
Be strong, and let your heart take courage,

chapters.superscription: For the Chief Musician. A Psalm by David.

verses.text: Blessed is he whose disobedience is forgiven,
Blessed is the man to whom the LORD doesn’t impute iniquity,
When I kept silence, my bones wasted away through my groaning all day long.
For day and night your hand was heavy on me.
I acknowledged my sin to you.
For this, let everyone who is godly pray to you in a time when you may be found.
You are my hiding place.
I will instruct you and teach you in the way which you shall go.
Don’t be like the horse, or like the mule, which have no understanding,
Many sorrows come to the wicked,
Be glad in the LORD, and rejoice, you righteous!

chapters.superscription: By David. A contemplative psalm.

verses.text: Rejoice in the LORD, you righteous!
Give thanks to the LORD with the lyre.
Sing to him a new song.
For the LORD’s word is right.
He loves righteousness and justice.
By the LORD’s word, the heavens were made:
He gathers the waters of the sea together as a heap.
Let all the earth fear the LORD.
For he spoke, and it was done.
The LORD brings the counsel of the nations to nothing.
The counsel of the LORD stands fast forever,
Blessed is the nation whose God is the LORD,
The LORD looks from heaven.
From the place of his habitation he looks out on all the inhabitants of the earth,
he who fashions all of their hearts;
There is no king saved by the multitude of an army.
A horse is a vain thing for safety,
Behold, the LORD’s eye is on those who fear him,
to deliver their soul from death,
Our soul has waited for the LORD.
For our heart rejoices in him,
Let your loving kindness be on us, LORD,
I will bless the LORD at all times.
My soul shall boast in the LORD.
Oh magnify the LORD with me.
I sought the LORD, and he answered me,
They looked to him, and were radiant.
This poor man cried, and the LORD heard him,
The LORD’s angel encamps around those who fear him,
Oh taste and see that the LORD is good.
Oh fear the LORD, you his saints,
The young lions do lack, and suffer hunger,
Come, you children, listen to me.
Who is someone who desires life,
Keep your tongue from evil,
Depart from evil, and do good.
The LORD’s eyes are towards the righteous.
The LORD’s face is against those who do evil,
The righteous cry, and the LORD hears,
The LORD is near to those who have a broken heart,
Many are the afflictions of the righteous,
He protects all of his bones.
Evil shall kill the wicked.
The LORD redeems the soul of his servants.

chapters.superscription: By David; when he pretended to be insane before Abimelech, who drove him away, and he departed.

verses.text: Contend, LORD, with those who contend with me.
Take hold of shield and buckler,
Brandish the spear and block those who pursue me.
Let those who seek after my soul be disappointed and brought to dishonour.
Let them be as chaff before the wind,
Let their way be dark and slippery,
For without cause they have hidden their net in a pit for me.
Let destruction come on him unawares.
My soul shall be joyful in the LORD.
All my bones shall say, “LORD, who is like you,
Unrighteous witnesses rise up.
They reward me evil for good,
But as for me, when they were sick, my clothing was sackcloth.
I behaved myself as though it had been my friend or my brother.
But in my adversity, they rejoiced, and gathered themselves together.
Like the profane mockers in feasts,
Lord, how long will you look on?
I will give you thanks in the great assembly.
Don’t let those who are my enemies wrongfully rejoice over me;
For they don’t speak peace,
Yes, they opened their mouth wide against me.
You have seen it, LORD. Don’t keep silent.
Wake up! Rise up to defend me, my God!
Vindicate me, LORD my God, according to your righteousness.
Don’t let them say in their heart, “Aha! That’s the way we want it!”
Let them be disappointed and confounded together who rejoice at my calamity.
Let those who favour my righteous cause shout for joy and be glad.
My tongue shall talk about your righteousness and about your praise all day long.

chapters.superscription: By David.

verses.text: A revelation is within my heart about the disobedience of the wicked:
For he flatters himself in his own eyes,
The words of his mouth are iniquity and deceit.
He plots iniquity on his bed.
Your loving kindness, LORD, is in the heavens.
Your righteousness is like the mountains of God.
How precious is your loving kindness, God!
They shall be abundantly satisfied with the abundance of your house.
For with you is the spring of life.
Oh continue your loving kindness to those who know you,
Don’t let the foot of pride come against me.
There the workers of iniquity are fallen.

chapters.superscription: For the Chief Musician. By David, the servant of the LORD.

verses.text: Don’t fret because of evildoers,
For they shall soon be cut down like the grass,
Trust in the LORD, and do good.
Also delight yourself in the LORD,
Commit your way to the LORD.
he will make your righteousness shine out like light,
Rest in the LORD, and wait patiently for him.
Cease from anger, and forsake wrath.
For evildoers shall be cut off,
For yet a little while, and the wicked will be no more.
But the humble shall inherit the land,
The wicked plots against the just,
The Lord will laugh at him,
The wicked have drawn out the sword, and have bent their bow,
Their sword shall enter into their own heart.
Better is a little that the righteous has,
For the arms of the wicked shall be broken,
The LORD knows the days of the perfect.
They shall not be disappointed in the time of evil.
But the wicked shall perish.
The wicked borrow, and don’t pay back,
For such as are blessed by him shall inherit the land.
A man’s steps are established by the LORD.
Though he stumble, he shall not fall,
I have been young, and now am old,
All day long he deals graciously, and lends.
Depart from evil, and do good.
For the LORD loves justice,
The righteous shall inherit the land,
The mouth of the righteous talks of wisdom.
The law of his God is in his heart.
The wicked watch the righteous,
The LORD will not leave him in his hand,
Wait for the LORD, and keep his way,
I have seen the wicked in great power,
But he passed away, and behold, he was not.
Mark the perfect man, and see the upright,
As for transgressors, they shall be destroyed together.
But the salvation of the righteous is from the LORD.
The LORD helps them and rescues them.

chapters.superscription: By David.

verses.text: LORD, don’t rebuke me in your wrath,
For your arrows have pierced me,
There is no soundness in my flesh because of your indignation,
For my iniquities have gone over my head.
My wounds are loathsome and corrupt
I am in pain and bowed down greatly.
For my waist is filled with burning.
I am faint and severely bruised.
Lord, all my desire is before you.
My heart throbs.
My lovers and my friends stand aloof from my plague.
They also who seek after my life lay snares.
But I, as a deaf man, don’t hear.
Yes, I am as a man who doesn’t hear,
For I hope in you, LORD.
For I said, “Don’t let them gloat over me,
For I am ready to fall.
For I will declare my iniquity.
But my enemies are vigorous and many.
They who give evil for good are also adversaries to me,
Don’t forsake me, LORD.
Hurry to help me,

chapters.superscription: A Psalm by David, for a memorial.

verses.text: I said, “I will watch my ways, so that I don’t sin with my tongue.
I was mute with silence.
My heart was hot within me.
“LORD, show me my end,
Behold, you have made my days hand widths.
“Surely every man walks like a shadow.
Now, Lord, what do I wait for?
Deliver me from all my transgressions.
I was mute.
Remove your scourge away from me.
When you rebuke and correct man for iniquity,
“Hear my prayer, LORD, and give ear to my cry.
Oh spare me, that I may recover strength,

chapters.superscription: For the Chief Musician. For Jeduthun. A Psalm by David.

verses.text: I waited patiently for the LORD.
He brought me up also out of a horrible pit,
He has put a new song in my mouth, even praise to our God.
Blessed is the man who makes the LORD his trust,
Many, LORD, my God, are the wonderful works which you have done,
Sacrifice and offering you didn’t desire.
Then I said, “Behold, I have come.
I delight to do your will, my God.
I have proclaimed glad news of righteousness in the great assembly.
I have not hidden your righteousness within my heart.
Don’t withhold your tender mercies from me, LORD.
For innumerable evils have surrounded me.
Be pleased, LORD, to deliver me.
Let them be disappointed and confounded together who seek after my soul to destroy it.
Let them be desolate by reason of their shame that tell me, “Aha! Aha!”
Let all those who seek you rejoice and be glad in you.
But I am poor and needy.

chapters.superscription: For the Chief Musician. A Psalm by David.

verses.text: Blessed is he who considers the poor.
The LORD will preserve him, and keep him alive.
The LORD will sustain him on his sickbed,
I said, “LORD, have mercy on me!
My enemies speak evil against me:
If he comes to see me, he speaks falsehood.
All who hate me whisper together against me.
“An evil disease”, they say, “has afflicted him.
Yes, my own familiar friend, in whom I trusted,
But you, LORD, have mercy on me, and raise me up,
By this I know that you delight in me,
As for me, you uphold me in my integrity,
Blessed be the LORD, the God of Israel,

chapters.superscription: For the Chief Musician. A Psalm by David.

verses.text: As the deer pants for the water brooks,
My soul thirsts for God, for the living God.
My tears have been my food day and night,
These things I remember, and pour out my soul within me,
Why are you in despair, my soul?
My God, my soul is in despair within me.
Deep calls to deep at the noise of your waterfalls.
The LORD will command his loving kindness in the daytime.
I will ask God, my rock, “Why have you forgotten me?
As with a sword in my bones, my adversaries reproach me,
Why are you in despair, my soul?

chapters.superscription: For the Chief Musician. A contemplation by the sons of Korah.

verses.text: Vindicate me, God, and plead my cause against an ungodly nation.
For you are the God of my strength. Why have you rejected me?
Oh, send out your light and your truth.
Then I will go to the altar of God,
Why are you in despair, my soul?
We have heard with our ears, God;
You drove out the nations with your hand,
For they didn’t get the land in possession by their own sword,
God, you are my King.
Through you, we will push down our adversaries.
For I will not trust in my bow,
But you have saved us from our adversaries,
In God we have made our boast all day long.
But now you rejected us, and brought us to dishonour,
You make us turn back from the adversary.
You have made us like sheep for food,
You sell your people for nothing,
You make us a reproach to our neighbours,
You make us a byword amongst the nations,
All day long my dishonour is before me,
at the taunt of one who reproaches and verbally abuses,
All this has come on us,
Our heart has not turned back,
though you have crushed us in the haunt of jackals,
If we have forgotten the name of our God,
won’t God search this out?
Yes, for your sake we are killed all day long.
Wake up!
Why do you hide your face,
For our soul is bowed down to the dust.
Rise up to help us.

chapters.superscription: For the Chief Musician. By the sons of Korah. A contemplative psalm.

verses.text: My heart overflows with a noble theme.
You are the most excellent of the sons of men.
Strap your sword on your thigh, O mighty one,
In your majesty ride on victoriously on behalf of truth, humility, and righteousness.
Your arrows are sharp.
Your throne, God, is forever and ever.
You have loved righteousness, and hated wickedness.
All your garments smell like myrrh, aloes, and cassia.
Kings’ daughters are amongst your honourable women.
Listen, daughter, consider, and turn your ear.
So the king will desire your beauty,
The daughter of Tyre comes with a gift.
The princess inside is all glorious.
She shall be led to the king in embroidered work.
With gladness and rejoicing they shall be led.
Your sons will take the place of your fathers.
I will make your name to be remembered in all generations.

chapters.superscription: For the Chief Musician. Set to “The Lilies.” A contemplation by the sons of Korah. A wedding song.

verses.text: God is our refuge and strength,
Therefore we won’t be afraid, though the earth changes,
though its waters roar and are troubled,
There is a river, the streams of which make the city of God glad,
God is within her. She shall not be moved.
The nations raged. The kingdoms were moved.
The LORD of Armies is with us.
Come, see the LORD’s works,
He makes wars cease to the end of the earth.
“Be still, and know that I am God.
The LORD of Armies is with us.

chapters.superscription: For the Chief Musician. By the sons of Korah. According to Alamoth.

verses.text: Oh clap your hands, all you nations.
For the LORD Most High is awesome.
He subdues nations under us,
He chooses our inheritance for us,
God has gone up with a shout,
Sing praises to God! Sing praises!
For God is the King of all the earth.
God reigns over the nations.
The princes of the peoples are gathered together,

chapters.superscription: For the Chief Musician. A Psalm by the sons of Korah.

verses.text: Great is the LORD, and greatly to be praised,
Beautiful in elevation, the joy of the whole earth,
God has shown himself in her citadels as a refuge.
For, behold, the kings assembled themselves,
They saw it, then they were amazed.
Trembling took hold of them there,
With the east wind, you break the ships of Tarshish.
As we have heard, so we have seen,
We have thought about your loving kindness, God,
As is your name, God,
Let Mount Zion be glad!
Walk about Zion, and go around her.
Notice her bulwarks.
For this God is our God forever and ever.

chapters.superscription: A Song. A Psalm by the sons of Korah.

verses.text: Hear this, all you peoples.
both low and high,
My mouth will speak words of wisdom.
I will incline my ear to a proverb.
Why should I fear in the days of evil,
Those who trust in their wealth,
none of them can by any means redeem his brother,
For the redemption of their life is costly,
that he should live on forever,
For he sees that wise men die;
Their inward thought is that their houses will endure forever,
But man, despite his riches, doesn’t endure.
This is the destiny of those who are foolish,
They are appointed as a flock for Sheol.
But God will redeem my soul from the power of Sheol,
Don’t be afraid when a man is made rich,
for when he dies he will carry nothing away.
Though while he lived he blessed his soul—
he shall go to the generation of his fathers.
A man who has riches without understanding,

chapters.superscription: For the Chief Musician. A Psalm by the sons of Korah.

verses.text: The Mighty One, God, the LORD, speaks,
Out of Zion, the perfection of beauty,
Our God comes, and does not keep silent.
He calls to the heavens above,
“Gather my saints together to me,
The heavens shall declare his righteousness,
“Hear, my people, and I will speak.
I don’t rebuke you for your sacrifices.
I have no need for a bull from your stall,
For every animal of the forest is mine,
I know all the birds of the mountains.
If I were hungry, I would not tell you,
Will I eat the meat of bulls,
Offer to God the sacrifice of thanksgiving.
Call on me in the day of trouble.
But to the wicked God says,
since you hate instruction,
When you saw a thief, you consented with him,
“You give your mouth to evil.
You sit and speak against your brother.
You have done these things, and I kept silent.
“Now consider this, you who forget God,
Whoever offers the sacrifice of thanksgiving glorifies me,

chapters.superscription: A Psalm by Asaph.

verses.text: Have mercy on me, God, according to your loving kindness.
Wash me thoroughly from my iniquity.
For I know my transgressions.
Against you, and you only, I have sinned,
Behold, I was born in iniquity.
Behold, you desire truth in the inward parts.
Purify me with hyssop, and I will be clean.
Let me hear joy and gladness,
Hide your face from my sins,
Create in me a clean heart, O God.
Don’t throw me from your presence,
Restore to me the joy of your salvation.
Then I will teach transgressors your ways.
Deliver me from the guilt of bloodshed, O God, the God of my salvation.
Lord, open my lips.
For you don’t delight in sacrifice, or else I would give it.
The sacrifices of God are a broken spirit.
Do well in your good pleasure to Zion.
Then you will delight in the sacrifices of righteousness,

chapters.superscription: For the Chief Musician. A Psalm by David, when Nathan the prophet came to him, after he had gone in to Bathsheba.

verses.text: Why do you boast of mischief, mighty man?
Your tongue plots destruction,
You love evil more than good,
You love all devouring words,
God will likewise destroy you forever.
The righteous also will see it, and fear,
“Behold, this is the man who didn’t make God his strength,
But as for me, I am like a green olive tree in God’s house.
I will give you thanks forever, because you have done it.

chapters.superscription: For the Chief Musician. A contemplation by David, when Doeg the Edomite came and told Saul, “David has come to Ahimelech’s house.”

verses.text: The fool has said in his heart, “There is no God.”
God looks down from heaven on the children of men,
Every one of them has gone back.
Have the workers of iniquity no knowledge,
There they were in great fear, where no fear was,
Oh that the salvation of Israel would come out of Zion!

chapters.superscription: For the Chief Musician. To the tune of “Mahalath.” A contemplation by David.

verses.text: Save me, God, by your name.
Hear my prayer, God.
For strangers have risen up against me.
Behold, God is my helper.
He will repay the evil to my enemies.
With a free will offering, I will sacrifice to you.
For he has delivered me out of all trouble.

chapters.superscription: For the Chief Musician. On stringed instruments. A contemplation by David, when the Ziphites came and said to Saul, “Isn’t David hiding himself amongst us?”

verses.text: Listen to my prayer, God.
Attend to me, and answer me.
because of the voice of the enemy,
My heart is severely pained within me.
Fearfulness and trembling have come on me.
I said, “Oh that I had wings like a dove!
Behold, then I would wander far off.
“I would hurry to a shelter from the stormy wind and storm.”
Confuse them, Lord, and confound their language,
Day and night they prowl around on its walls.
Destructive forces are within her.
For it was not an enemy who insulted me,
But it was you, a man like me,
We took sweet fellowship together.
Let death come suddenly on them.
As for me, I will call on God.
Evening, morning, and at noon, I will cry out in distress.
He has redeemed my soul in peace from the battle that was against me,
God, who is enthroned forever,
He raises his hands against his friends.
His mouth was smooth as butter,
Cast your burden on the LORD and he will sustain you.
But you, God, will bring them down into the pit of destruction.

chapters.superscription: For the Chief Musician. On stringed instruments. A contemplation by David.

verses.text: Be merciful to me, God, for man wants to swallow me up.
My enemies want to swallow me up all day long,
When I am afraid,
In God, I praise his word.
All day long they twist my words.
They conspire and lurk,
Shall they escape by iniquity?
You count my wanderings.
Then my enemies shall turn back in the day that I call.
In God, I will praise his word.
I have put my trust in God.
Your vows are on me, God.
For you have delivered my soul from death,

chapters.superscription: For the Chief Musician. To the tune of “Silent Dove in Distant Lands.” A poem by David, when the Philistines seized him in Gath.

verses.text: Be merciful to me, God, be merciful to me,
I cry out to God Most High,
He will send from heaven, and save me,
My soul is amongst lions.
Be exalted, God, above the heavens!
They have prepared a net for my steps.
My heart is steadfast, God.
Wake up, my glory! Wake up, lute and harp!
I will give thanks to you, Lord, amongst the peoples.
For your great loving kindness reaches to the heavens,
Be exalted, God, above the heavens.

chapters.superscription: For the Chief Musician. To the tune of “Do Not Destroy.” A poem by David, when he fled from Saul, in the cave.

verses.text: Do you indeed speak righteousness, silent ones?
No, in your heart you plot injustice.
The wicked go astray from the womb.
Their poison is like the poison of a snake,
which doesn’t listen to the voice of charmers,
Break their teeth, God, in their mouth.
Let them vanish like water that flows away.
Let them be like a snail which melts and passes away,
Before your pots can feel the heat of the thorns,
The righteous shall rejoice when he sees the vengeance.
so that men shall say, “Most certainly there is a reward for the righteous.

chapters.superscription: For the Chief Musician. To the tune of “Do Not Destroy.” A poem by David.

verses.text: Deliver me from my enemies, my God.
Deliver me from the workers of iniquity.
For, behold, they lie in wait for my soul.
I have done no wrong, yet they are ready to attack me.
You, LORD God of Armies, the God of Israel,
They return at evening, howling like dogs,
Behold, they spew with their mouth.
But you, LORD, laugh at them.
Oh, my Strength, I watch for you,
My God will go before me with his loving kindness.
Don’t kill them, or my people may forget.
For the sin of their mouth, and the words of their lips,
Consume them in wrath.
At evening let them return.
They shall wander up and down for food,
But I will sing of your strength.
To you, my strength, I will sing praises.

chapters.superscription: For the Chief Musician. To the tune of “Do Not Destroy.” A poem by David, when Saul sent, and they watched the house to kill him.

verses.text: God, you have rejected us.
You have made the land tremble.
You have shown your people hard things.
You have given a banner to those who fear you,
So that your beloved may be delivered,
God has spoken from his sanctuary:
Gilead is mine, and Manasseh is mine.
Moab is my wash basin.
Who will bring me into the strong city?
Haven’t you, God, rejected us?
Give us help against the adversary,
Through God we will do valiantly,

chapters.superscription: For the Chief Musician. To the tune of “The Lily of the Covenant.” A teaching poem by David, when he fought with Aram Naharaim and with Aram Zobah, and Joab returned, and killed twelve thousand of Edom in the Valley of Salt.

verses.text: Hear my cry, God.
From the end of the earth, I will call to you when my heart is overwhelmed.
For you have been a refuge for me,
I will dwell in your tent forever.
For you, God, have heard my vows.
You will prolong the king’s life.
He shall be enthroned in God’s presence forever.
So I will sing praise to your name forever,

chapters.superscription: For the Chief Musician. For a stringed instrument. By David.

verses.text: My soul rests in God alone.
He alone is my rock, my salvation, and my fortress.
How long will you assault a man?
They fully intend to throw him down from his lofty place.
My soul, wait in silence for God alone,
He alone is my rock and my salvation, my fortress.
My salvation and my honour is with God.
Trust in him at all times, you people.
Surely men of low degree are just a breath,
Don’t trust in oppression.
God has spoken once;
Also to you, Lord, belongs loving kindness,

chapters.superscription: For the Chief Musician. To Jeduthun. A Psalm by David.

verses.text: God, you are my God.
So I have seen you in the sanctuary,
Because your loving kindness is better than life,
So I will bless you while I live.
My soul shall be satisfied as with the richest food.
when I remember you on my bed,
For you have been my help.
My soul stays close to you.
But those who seek my soul to destroy it
They shall be given over to the power of the sword.
But the king shall rejoice in God.

chapters.superscription: A Psalm by David, when he was in the desert of Judah.

verses.text: Hear my voice, God, in my complaint.
Hide me from the conspiracy of the wicked,
who sharpen their tongue like a sword,
to shoot innocent men from ambushes.
They encourage themselves in evil plans.
They plot injustice, saying, “We have made a perfect plan!”
But God will shoot at them.
Their own tongues shall ruin them.
All mankind shall be afraid.
The righteous shall be glad in the LORD,

chapters.superscription: For the Chief Musician. A Psalm by David.

verses.text: Praise waits for you, God, in Zion.
You who hear prayer,
Sins overwhelmed me,
Blessed is the one whom you choose and cause to come near,
By awesome deeds of righteousness, you answer us,
By your power, you form the mountains,
You still the roaring of the seas,
They also who dwell in faraway places are afraid at your wonders.
You visit the earth, and water it.
You drench its furrows.
You crown the year with your bounty.
The wilderness grasslands overflow.
The pastures are covered with flocks.

chapters.superscription: For the Chief Musician. A Psalm by David. A song.

verses.text: Make a joyful shout to God, all the earth!
Sing to the glory of his name!
Tell God, “How awesome are your deeds!
All the earth will worship you,
Come, and see God’s deeds—
He turned the sea into dry land.
He rules by his might forever.
Praise our God, you peoples!
who preserves our life amongst the living,
For you, God, have tested us.
You brought us into prison.
You allowed men to ride over our heads.
I will come into your temple with burnt offerings.
which my lips promised,
I will offer to you burnt offerings of fat animals,
Come and hear, all you who fear God.
I cried to him with my mouth.
If I cherished sin in my heart,
But most certainly, God has listened.
Blessed be God, who has not turned away my prayer,

chapters.superscription: For the Chief Musician. A song. A Psalm.

verses.text: May God be merciful to us, bless us,
That your way may be known on earth,
let the peoples praise you, God.
Oh let the nations be glad and sing for joy,
Let the peoples praise you, God.
The earth has yielded its increase.
God will bless us.

chapters.superscription: For the Chief Musician. With stringed instruments. A Psalm. A song.

verses.text: Let God arise!
As smoke is driven away,
But let the righteous be glad.
Sing to God! Sing praises to his name!
A father of the fatherless, and a defender of the widows,
God sets the lonely in families.
God, when you went out before your people,
The earth trembled.
You, God, sent a plentiful rain.
Your congregation lived therein.
The Lord announced the word.
“Kings of armies flee! They flee!”
while you sleep amongst the camp fires,
When the Almighty scattered kings in her,
The mountains of Bashan are majestic mountains.
Why do you look in envy, you rugged mountains,
The chariots of God are tens of thousands and thousands of thousands.
You have ascended on high.
Blessed be the Lord, who daily bears our burdens,
God is to us a God of deliverance.
But God will strike through the head of his enemies,
The Lord said, “I will bring you again from Bashan,
that you may crush them, dipping your foot in blood,
They have seen your processions, God,
The singers went before, the minstrels followed after,
“Bless God in the congregations,
There is little Benjamin, their ruler,
Your God has commanded your strength.
Because of your temple at Jerusalem,
Rebuke the wild animal of the reeds,
Princes shall come out of Egypt.
Sing to God, you kingdoms of the earth!
to him who rides on the heaven of heavens, which are of old;
Ascribe strength to God!
You are awesome, God, in your sanctuaries.

chapters.superscription: For the Chief Musician. A Psalm by David. A song.

verses.text: Save me, God,
I sink in deep mire, where there is no foothold.
I am weary with my crying.
Those who hate me without a cause are more than the hairs of my head.
God, you know my foolishness.
Don’t let those who wait for you be shamed through me, Lord GOD of Armies.
Because for your sake, I have borne reproach.
I have become a stranger to my brothers,
For the zeal of your house consumes me.
When I wept and I fasted,
When I made sackcloth my clothing,
Those who sit in the gate talk about me.
But as for me, my prayer is to you, LORD, in an acceptable time.
Deliver me out of the mire, and don’t let me sink.
Don’t let the flood waters overwhelm me,
Answer me, LORD, for your loving kindness is good.
Don’t hide your face from your servant,
Draw near to my soul and redeem it.
You know my reproach, my shame, and my dishonour.
Reproach has broken my heart, and I am full of heaviness.
They also gave me poison for my food.
Let their table before them become a snare.
Let their eyes be darkened, so that they can’t see.
Pour out your indignation on them.
Let their habitation be desolate.
For they persecute him whom you have wounded.
Charge them with crime upon crime.
Let them be blotted out of the book of life,
But I am in pain and distress.
I will praise the name of God with a song,
It will please the LORD better than an ox,
The humble have seen it, and are glad.
For the LORD hears the needy,
Let heaven and earth praise him;
For God will save Zion, and build the cities of Judah.
The children also of his servants shall inherit it.

chapters.superscription: For the Chief Musician. To the tune of “Lilies.” By David.

verses.text: Hurry, God, to deliver me.
Let them be disappointed and confounded who seek my soul.
Let them be turned because of their shame
Let all those who seek you rejoice and be glad in you.
But I am poor and needy.

chapters.superscription: For the Chief Musician. By David. A reminder.

verses.text: In you, LORD, I take refuge.
Deliver me in your righteousness, and rescue me.
Be to me a rock of refuge to which I may always go.
Rescue me, my God, from the hand of the wicked,
For you are my hope, Lord GOD,
I have relied on you from the womb.
I am a marvel to many,
My mouth shall be filled with your praise,
Don’t reject me in my old age.
For my enemies talk about me.
saying, “God has forsaken him.
God, don’t be far from me.
Let my accusers be disappointed and consumed.
But I will always hope,
My mouth will tell about your righteousness,
I will come with the mighty acts of the Lord GOD.
God, you have taught me from my youth.
Yes, even when I am old and grey-haired, God, don’t forsake me,
God, your righteousness also reaches to the heavens.
You, who have shown us many and bitter troubles,
Increase my honour
I will also praise you with the harp for your faithfulness, my God.
My lips shall shout for joy!
My tongue will also talk about your righteousness all day long,
God, give the king your justice;
He will judge your people with righteousness,
The mountains shall bring prosperity to the people.
He will judge the poor of the people.
They shall fear you while the sun endures;
He will come down like rain on the mown grass,
In his days, the righteous shall flourish,
He shall have dominion also from sea to sea,
Those who dwell in the wilderness shall bow before him.
The kings of Tarshish and of the islands will bring tribute.
Yes, all kings shall fall down before him.
For he will deliver the needy when he cries;
He will have pity on the poor and needy.
He will redeem their soul from oppression and violence.
He will live; and Sheba’s gold will be given to him.
Abundance of grain shall be throughout the land.
His name endures forever.
Praise be to the LORD God, the God of Israel,
Blessed be his glorious name forever!
This ends the prayers by David, the son of Jesse.

chapters.superscription: By Solomon.

verses.text: Surely God is good to Israel,
But as for me, my feet were almost gone.
For I was envious of the arrogant,
For there are no struggles in their death,
They are free from burdens of men,
Therefore pride is like a chain around their neck.
Their eyes bulge with fat.
They scoff and speak with malice.
They have set their mouth in the heavens.
Therefore their people return to them,
They say, “How does God know?
Behold, these are the wicked.
Surely I have cleansed my heart in vain,
For all day long I have been plagued,
If I had said, “I will speak thus”,
When I tried to understand this,
until I entered God’s sanctuary,
Surely you set them in slippery places.
How they are suddenly destroyed!
As a dream when one wakes up,
For my soul was grieved.
I was so senseless and ignorant.
Nevertheless, I am continually with you.
You will guide me with your counsel,
Whom do I have in heaven?
My flesh and my heart fails,
For, behold, those who are far from you shall perish.
But it is good for me to come close to God.

chapters.superscription: A Psalm by Asaph.

verses.text: God, why have you rejected us forever?
Remember your congregation, which you purchased of old,
Lift up your feet to the perpetual ruins,
Your adversaries have roared in the middle of your assembly.
They behaved like men wielding axes,
Now they break all its carved work down with hatchet and hammers.
They have burnt your sanctuary to the ground.
They said in their heart, “We will crush them completely.”
We see no miraculous signs.
How long, God, shall the adversary reproach?
Why do you draw back your hand, even your right hand?
Yet God is my King of old,
You divided the sea by your strength.
You broke the heads of Leviathan in pieces.
You opened up spring and stream.
The day is yours, the night is also yours.
You have set all the boundaries of the earth.
Remember this, that the enemy has mocked you, LORD.
Don’t deliver the soul of your dove to wild beasts.
Honour your covenant,
Don’t let the oppressed return ashamed.
Arise, God! Plead your own cause.
Don’t forget the voice of your adversaries.

chapters.superscription: A contemplation by Asaph.

verses.text: We give thanks to you, God.
When I choose the appointed time,
The earth and all its inhabitants quake.
I said to the arrogant, “Don’t boast!”
Don’t lift up your horn on high.
For neither from the east, nor from the west,
But God is the judge.
For in the LORD’s hand there is a cup,
But I will declare this forever:
I will cut off all the horns of the wicked,

chapters.superscription: For the Chief Musician. To the tune of “Do Not Destroy.” A Psalm by Asaph. A song.

verses.text: In Judah, God is known.
His tabernacle is also in Salem.
There he broke the flaming arrows of the bow,
Glorious are you, and excellent,
Valiant men lie plundered,
At your rebuke, God of Jacob,
You, even you, are to be feared.
You pronounced judgement from heaven.
when God arose to judgement,
Surely the wrath of man praises you.
Make vows to the LORD your God, and fulfil them!
He will cut off the spirit of princes.

chapters.superscription: For the Chief Musician. On stringed instruments. A Psalm by Asaph. A song.

verses.text: My cry goes to God!
In the day of my trouble I sought the Lord.
I remember God, and I groan.
You hold my eyelids open.
I have considered the days of old,
I remember my song in the night.
“Will the Lord reject us forever?
Has his loving kindness vanished forever?
Has God forgotten to be gracious?
Then I thought, “I will appeal to this:
I will remember the LORD’s deeds;
I will also meditate on all your work,
Your way, God, is in the sanctuary.
You are the God who does wonders.
You have redeemed your people with your arm,
The waters saw you, God.
The clouds poured out water.
The voice of your thunder was in the whirlwind.
Your way was through the sea,
You led your people like a flock,

chapters.superscription: For the Chief Musician. To Jeduthun. A Psalm by Asaph.

verses.text: Hear my teaching, my people.
I will open my mouth in a parable.
which we have heard and known,
We will not hide them from their children,
For he established a covenant in Jacob,
that the generation to come might know, even the children who should be born;
that they might set their hope in God,
and might not be as their fathers—
The children of Ephraim, being armed and carrying bows,
They didn’t keep God’s covenant,
They forgot his doings,
He did marvellous things in the sight of their fathers,
He split the sea, and caused them to pass through.
In the daytime he also led them with a cloud,
He split rocks in the wilderness,
He brought streams also out of the rock,
Yet they still went on to sin against him,
They tempted God in their heart
Yes, they spoke against God.
Behold, he struck the rock, so that waters gushed out,
Therefore the LORD heard, and was angry.
because they didn’t believe in God,
Yet he commanded the skies above,
He rained down manna on them to eat,
Man ate the bread of angels.
He caused the east wind to blow in the sky.
He also rained meat on them as the dust,

They didn’t turn from their cravings.
when the anger of God went up against them,
For all this they still sinned,
Therefore he consumed their days in vanity,
When he killed them, then they enquired after him.
They remembered that God was their rock,

For their heart was not right with him,
But he, being merciful, forgave iniquity, and didn’t destroy them.
He remembered that they were but flesh,

They turned again and tempted God,
They didn’t remember his hand,
how he set his signs in Egypt,
he turned their rivers into blood,

and struck all the firstborn in Egypt,

from following the ewes that have their young,

chapters.superscription: A contemplation by Asaph.

verses.text: God, the nations have come into your inheritance.
They have given the dead bodies of your servants to be food for the birds of the sky,
They have shed their blood like water around Jerusalem.
We have become a reproach to our neighbours,
How long, LORD?
Pour out your wrath on the nations that don’t know you,
for they have devoured Jacob,
Don’t hold the iniquities of our forefathers against us.
Help us, God of our salvation, for the glory of your name.
Why should the nations say, “Where is their God?”
Let the sighing of the prisoner come before you.
Pay back to our neighbours seven times into their bosom
So we, your people and sheep of your pasture,

chapters.superscription: A Psalm by Asaph.

verses.text: Hear us, Shepherd of Israel,
Before Ephraim, Benjamin, and Manasseh, stir up your might!
Turn us again, God.
LORD God of Armies,
You have fed them with the bread of tears,
You make us a source of contention to our neighbours.
Turn us again, God of Armies.
You brought a vine out of Egypt.
You cleared the ground for it.
The mountains were covered with its shadow.
It sent out its branches to the sea,
Why have you broken down its walls,
The boar out of the wood ravages it.
Turn again, we beg you, God of Armies.
the stock which your right hand planted,
It’s burnt with fire.
Let your hand be on the man of your right hand,
So we will not turn away from you.
Turn us again, LORD God of Armies.

chapters.superscription: For the Chief Musician. To the tune of “The Lilies of the Covenant.” A Psalm by Asaph.

verses.text: Sing aloud to God, our strength!
Raise a song, and bring here the tambourine,
Blow the trumpet at the New Moon,
For it is a statute for Israel,
He appointed it in Joseph for a covenant,
“I removed his shoulder from the burden.
You called in trouble, and I delivered you.
“Hear, my people, and I will testify to you,
There shall be no strange god in you,
I am the LORD, your God,
But my people didn’t listen to my voice.
So I let them go after the stubbornness of their hearts,
Oh that my people would listen to me,
I would soon subdue their enemies,
The haters of the LORD would cringe before him,
But he would have also fed them with the finest of the wheat.

chapters.superscription: For the Chief Musician. On an instrument of Gath. By Asaph.

verses.text: God presides in the great assembly.
“How long will you judge unjustly,
“Defend the weak, the poor, and the fatherless.
Rescue the weak and needy.
They don’t know, neither do they understand.
I said, “You are gods,
Nevertheless you shall die like men,
Arise, God, judge the earth,

chapters.superscription: A Psalm by Asaph.

verses.text: God, don’t keep silent.
For, behold, your enemies are stirred up.
They conspire with cunning against your people.
“Come,” they say, “let’s destroy them as a nation,
For they have conspired together with one mind.
The tents of Edom and the Ishmaelites;
Gebal, Ammon, and Amalek;
Assyria also is joined with them.
Do to them as you did to Midian,
who perished at Endor,
Make their nobles like Oreb and Zeeb,
who said, “Let’s take possession of God’s pasture lands.”
My God, make them like tumbleweed,
As the fire that burns the forest,
so pursue them with your tempest,
Fill their faces with confusion,
Let them be disappointed and dismayed forever.
that they may know that you alone, whose name is the LORD,

chapters.superscription: A song. A Psalm by Asaph.

verses.text: How lovely are your dwellings,
My soul longs, and even faints for the courts of the LORD.
Yes, the sparrow has found a home,
Blessed are those who dwell in your house.
Blessed are those whose strength is in you,
Passing through the valley of Weeping, they make it a place of springs.
They go from strength to strength.
LORD, God of Armies, hear my prayer.
Behold, God our shield,
For a day in your courts is better than a thousand.
For the LORD God is a sun and a shield.
LORD of Armies,

chapters.superscription: For the Chief Musician. On an instrument of Gath. A Psalm by the sons of Korah.

verses.text: LORD, you have been favourable to your land.
You have forgiven the iniquity of your people.
You have taken away all your wrath.
Turn us, God of our salvation,
Will you be angry with us forever?
Won’t you revive us again,
Show us your loving kindness, LORD.
I will hear what God, the LORD, will speak,
Surely his salvation is near those who fear him,
Mercy and truth meet together.
Truth springs out of the earth.
Yes, the LORD will give that which is good.
Righteousness goes before him,

chapters.superscription: For the Chief Musician. A Psalm by the sons of Korah.

verses.text: Hear, LORD, and answer me,
Preserve my soul, for I am godly.
Be merciful to me, Lord,
Bring joy to the soul of your servant,
For you, Lord, are good, and ready to forgive,
Hear, LORD, my prayer.
In the day of my trouble I will call on you,
There is no one like you amongst the gods, Lord,
All nations you have made will come and worship before you, Lord.
For you are great, and do wondrous things.
Teach me your way, LORD.
I will praise you, Lord my God, with my whole heart.
For your loving kindness is great towards me.
God, the proud have risen up against me.
But you, Lord, are a merciful and gracious God,
Turn to me, and have mercy on me!
Show me a sign of your goodness,

chapters.superscription: A Prayer by David.

verses.text: His foundation is in the holy mountains.
The LORD loves the gates of Zion more than all the dwellings of Jacob.
Glorious things are spoken about you, city of God. Selah.*
I will record Rahab and Babylon amongst those who acknowledge me.
Yes, of Zion it will be said, “This one and that one was born in her;”
The LORD will count, when he writes up the peoples,
Those who sing as well as those who dance say,

chapters.superscription: A Psalm by the sons of Korah; a Song.

verses.text: LORD, the God of my salvation,
Let my prayer enter into your presence.
For my soul is full of troubles.
I am counted amongst those who go down into the pit.
set apart amongst the dead,
You have laid me in the lowest pit,
Your wrath lies heavily on me.
You have taken my friends from me.
My eyes are dim from grief.
Do you show wonders to the dead?
Is your loving kindness declared in the grave?
Are your wonders made known in the dark?
But to you, LORD, I have cried.
LORD, why do you reject my soul?
I am afflicted and ready to die from my youth up.
Your fierce wrath has gone over me.
They came around me like water all day long.
You have put lover and friend far from me,

chapters.superscription: A Song. A Psalm by the sons of Korah. For the Chief Musician. To the tune of “The Suffering of Affliction.” A contemplation by Heman, the Ezrahite.

verses.text: I will sing of the loving kindness of the LORD forever.
I indeed declare, “Love stands firm forever.
“I have made a covenant with my chosen one,
‘I will establish your offspring forever,
The heavens will praise your wonders, LORD,
For who in the skies can be compared to the LORD?
a very awesome God in the council of the holy ones,
LORD, God of Armies, who is a mighty one, like you?
You rule the pride of the sea.

Then you spoke in vision to your saints,
I have found David, my servant.
with whom my hand shall be established.
No enemy will tax him.
I will beat down his adversaries before him,

I will also appoint him my firstborn,

I will also make his offspring endure forever,

then I will punish their sin with the rod,

How long, LORD?

chapters.superscription: A contemplation by Ethan, the Ezrahite.

verses.text: Lord, you have been our dwelling place for all generations.
Before the mountains were born,
You turn man to destruction, saying,
For a thousand years in your sight are just like yesterday when it is past,
You sweep them away as they sleep.
In the morning it sprouts and springs up.
For we are consumed in your anger.
You have set our iniquities before you,
For all our days have passed away in your wrath.
The days of our years are seventy,
Who knows the power of your anger,
So teach us to count our days,
Relent, LORD!
Satisfy us in the morning with your loving kindness,
Make us glad for as many days as you have afflicted us,
Let your work appear to your servants,
Let the favour of the Lord our God be on us.

chapters.superscription: A Prayer by Moses, the man of God.

verses.text: He who dwells in the secret place of the Most High
I will say of the LORD, “He is my refuge and my fortress;
For he will deliver you from the snare of the fowler,
He will cover you with his feathers.
You shall not be afraid of the terror by night,
nor of the pestilence that walks in darkness,
A thousand may fall at your side,
You will only look with your eyes,
Because you have made the LORD your refuge,
no evil shall happen to you,
For he will put his angels in charge of you,
They will bear you up in their hands,
You will tread on the lion and cobra.
“Because he has set his love on me, therefore I will deliver him.
He will call on me, and I will answer him.
I will satisfy him with long life,
It is a good thing to give thanks to the LORD,
to proclaim your loving kindness in the morning,
with the ten-stringed lute, with the harp,
For you, LORD, have made me glad through your work.
How great are your works, LORD!
A senseless man doesn’t know,
though the wicked spring up as the grass,
But you, LORD, are on high forever more.
For behold, your enemies, LORD,
But you have exalted my horn like that of the wild ox.
My eye has also seen my enemies.
The righteous shall flourish like the palm tree.
They are planted in the LORD’s house.
They will still produce fruit in old age.
to show that the LORD is upright.

chapters.superscription: A Psalm. A song for the Sabbath day.

verses.text: The LORD reigns!
Your throne is established from long ago.
The floods have lifted up, LORD,
Above the voices of many waters,
Your statutes stand firm.
LORD, you God to whom vengeance belongs,
Rise up, you judge of the earth.
LORD, how long will the wicked,
They pour out arrogant words.
They break your people in pieces, LORD,
They kill the widow and the alien,
They say, “The LORD will not see,
Consider, you senseless amongst the people;
He who implanted the ear, won’t he hear?
He who disciplines the nations, won’t he punish?
The LORD knows the thoughts of man,
Blessed is the man whom you discipline, LORD,
that you may give him rest from the days of adversity,
For the LORD won’t reject his people,
For judgement will return to righteousness.
Who will rise up for me against the wicked?
Unless the LORD had been my help,
When I said, “My foot is slipping!”
In the multitude of my thoughts within me,
Shall the throne of wickedness have fellowship with you,
They gather themselves together against the soul of the righteous,
But the LORD has been my high tower,
He has brought on them their own iniquity,
Oh come, let’s sing to the LORD.
Let’s come before his presence with thanksgiving.
For the LORD is a great God,
In his hand are the deep places of the earth.
The sea is his, and he made it.
Oh come, let’s worship and bow down.
for he is our God.
Don’t harden your heart, as at Meribah,
when your fathers tempted me,

Sing to the LORD a new song!
Sing to the LORD!
Declare his glory amongst the nations,

For all the gods of the peoples are idols,

Ascribe to the LORD, you families of nations,

Worship the LORD in holy array.
Say amongst the nations, “The LORD reigns.”
Let the heavens be glad, and let the earth rejoice.
Let the field and all that is in it exult!
before the LORD; for he comes,

Clouds and darkness are around him.

For you, LORD, are most high above all the earth.

Let them sing before the LORD,

chapters.superscription: A Psalm.

verses.text: The LORD reigns! Let the peoples tremble.
The LORD is great in Zion.
Let them praise your great and awesome name.
The King’s strength also loves justice.
Exalt the LORD our God.
Moses and Aaron were amongst his priests,
He spoke to them in the pillar of cloud.
You answered them, LORD our God.
Exalt the LORD, our God.
Shout for joy to the LORD, all you lands!
Serve the LORD with gladness.
Know that the LORD, he is God.
Enter into his gates with thanksgiving,
For the LORD is good.

chapters.superscription: A Psalm of thanksgiving.

verses.text: I will sing of loving kindness and justice.
I will be careful to live a blameless life.
I will set no vile thing before my eyes.
A perverse heart will be far from me.
I will silence whoever secretly slanders his neighbour.
My eyes will be on the faithful of the land,
He who practices deceit won’t dwell within my house.
Morning by morning, I will destroy all the wicked of the land,

chapters.superscription: A Psalm by David.

verses.text: Hear my prayer, LORD!
Don’t hide your face from me in the day of my distress.
For my days consume away like smoke.
My heart is blighted like grass, and withered,
By reason of the voice of my groaning,
I am like a pelican of the wilderness.
I watch, and have become like a sparrow that is alone on the housetop.
My enemies reproach me all day.
For I have eaten ashes like bread,
because of your indignation and your wrath;
My days are like a long shadow.
But you, LORD, will remain forever;
You will arise and have mercy on Zion,
For your servants take pleasure in her stones,
So the nations will fear the LORD’s name,
For the LORD has built up Zion.
He has responded to the prayer of the destitute,
This will be written for the generation to come.
for he has looked down from the height of his sanctuary.
to hear the groans of the prisoner,
that men may declare the LORD’s name in Zion,
when the peoples are gathered together,
He weakened my strength along the course.
I said, “My God, don’t take me away in the middle of my days.
Of old, you laid the foundation of the earth.
They will perish, but you will endure.
But you are the same.
The children of your servants will continue.

chapters.superscription: A Prayer of the afflicted, when he is overwhelmed and pours out his complaint before the LORD.

verses.text: Praise the LORD, my soul!
Praise the LORD, my soul,
who forgives all your sins,
who redeems your life from destruction,
who satisfies your desire with good things,
The LORD executes righteous acts,
He made known his ways to Moses,
The LORD is merciful and gracious,
He will not always accuse;
He has not dealt with us according to our sins,
For as the heavens are high above the earth,
As far as the east is from the west,
Like a father has compassion on his children,
For he knows how we are made.
As for man, his days are like grass.
For the wind passes over it, and it is gone.
But the LORD’s loving kindness is from everlasting to everlasting with those who fear him,
to those who keep his covenant,
The LORD has established his throne in the heavens.
Praise the LORD, you angels of his,
Praise the LORD, all you armies of his,
Praise the LORD, all you works of his,

chapters.superscription: By David.

verses.text: Bless the LORD, my soul.
He covers himself with light as with a garment.
He lays the beams of his rooms in the waters.
He makes his messengers winds,
He laid the foundations of the earth,
You covered it with the deep as with a cloak.
At your rebuke they fled.
The mountains rose,
You have set a boundary that they may not pass over,
He sends springs into the valleys.
They give drink to every animal of the field.
The birds of the sky nest by them.
He waters the mountains from his rooms.
He causes the grass to grow for the livestock,
wine that makes the heart of man glad,
The LORD’s trees are well watered,
where the birds make their nests.
The high mountains are for the wild goats.
He appointed the moon for seasons.
You make darkness, and it is night,
The young lions roar after their prey,
The sun rises, and they steal away,
Man goes out to his work,
LORD, how many are your works!
There is the sea, great and wide,
There the ships go,
These all wait for you,
You give to them; they gather.
You hide your face; they are troubled.
You send out your Spirit and they are created.
Let the LORD’s glory endure forever.
He looks at the earth, and it trembles.
I will sing to the LORD as long as I live.
Let my meditation be sweet to him.
Let sinners be consumed out of the earth.
Give thanks to the LORD! Call on his name!
Sing to him, sing praises to him!
Glory in his holy name.
Seek the LORD and his strength.
Remember his marvellous works that he has done:
you offspring of Abraham, his servant,
He is the LORD, our God.
He has remembered his covenant forever,
the covenant which he made with Abraham,
and confirmed it to Jacob for a statute;
saying, “To you I will give the land of Canaan,
when they were but a few men in number,
They went about from nation to nation,

“Don’t touch my anointed ones!

until the time that his word happened,

to discipline his princes at his pleasure,

that they might keep his statutes,

that I may see the prosperity of your chosen,

but gave in to craving in the desert,

but murmured in their tents,

Save us, LORD, our God,

and gathered out of the lands,

Hungry and thirsty,

Again, they are diminished and bowed down

My heart is steadfast, God.

I will give thanks to you, LORD, amongst the nations.

That your beloved may be delivered,
