Through God, we will do valiantly,

chapters.superscription: A Song. A Psalm by David.

verses.text: God of my praise, don’t remain silent,
for they have opened the mouth of the wicked and the mouth of deceit against me.
They have also surrounded me with words of hatred,
In return for my love, they are my adversaries;
They have rewarded me evil for good,
Set a wicked man over him.
When he is judged, let him come out guilty.
Let his days be few.
Let his children be fatherless,
Let his children be wandering beggars.
Let the creditor seize all that he has.
Let there be no one to extend kindness to him,
Let his posterity be cut off.
Let the iniquity of his fathers be remembered by the LORD.
Let them be before the LORD continually,
because he didn’t remember to show kindness,
Yes, he loved cursing, and it came to him.
He clothed himself also with cursing as with his garment.
Let it be to him as the clothing with which he covers himself,
This is the reward of my adversaries from the LORD,
But deal with me, GOD the Lord, for your name’s sake,
for I am poor and needy.
I fade away like an evening shadow.
My knees are weak through fasting.
I have also become a reproach to them.
Help me, LORD, my God.
that they may know that this is your hand;
They may curse, but you bless.
Let my adversaries be clothed with dishonour.
I will give great thanks to the LORD with my mouth.
For he will stand at the right hand of the needy,

chapters.superscription: For the Chief Musician. A Psalm by David.

verses.text: The LORD says to my Lord, “Sit at my right hand,
The LORD will send out the rod of your strength out of Zion.
Your people offer themselves willingly in the day of your power, in holy array.
The LORD has sworn, and will not change his mind:
The Lord is at your right hand.
He will judge amongst the nations.
He will drink of the brook on the way;

chapters.superscription: A Psalm by David.

verses.text: Praise the LORD!
The LORD’s works are great,
His work is honour and majesty.
He has caused his wonderful works to be remembered.
He has given food to those who fear him.
He has shown his people the power of his works,
The works of his hands are truth and justice.
They are established forever and ever.
He has sent redemption to his people.
The fear of the LORD is the beginning of wisdom.
Praise the LORD!
His offspring will be mighty in the land.
Wealth and riches are in his house.
Light dawns in the darkness for the upright,
It is well with the man who deals graciously and lends.
For he will never be shaken.
He will not be afraid of evil news.
His heart is established.
He has dispersed, he has given to the poor.
The wicked will see it, and be grieved.
Praise the LORD!
Blessed be the LORD’s name,
From the rising of the sun to its going down,
The LORD is high above all nations,
Who is like the LORD, our God,
who stoops down to see in heaven and in the earth?
He raises up the poor out of the dust,
that he may set him with princes,
He settles the barren woman in her home
When Israel went out of Egypt,
Judah became his sanctuary,
The sea saw it, and fled.
The mountains skipped like rams,
What was it, you sea, that you fled?
You mountains, that you skipped like rams?
Tremble, you earth, at the presence of the Lord,
who turned the rock into a pool of water,
Not to us, LORD, not to us,
Why should the nations say,
But our God is in the heavens.
Their idols are silver and gold,
They have mouths, but they don’t speak.
They have ears, but they don’t hear.
They have hands, but they don’t feel.
Those who make them will be like them;
Israel, trust in the LORD!
House of Aaron, trust in the LORD!
You who fear the LORD, trust in the LORD!
The LORD remembers us. He will bless us.
He will bless those who fear the LORD,
May the LORD increase you more and more,
Blessed are you by the LORD,
The heavens are the LORD’s heavens,
The dead don’t praise the LORD,
but we will bless the LORD,
I love the LORD, because he listens to my voice,
Because he has turned his ear to me,
The cords of death surrounded me,
Then I called on the LORD’s name:
The LORD is gracious and righteous.
The LORD preserves the simple.
Return to your rest, my soul,
For you have delivered my soul from death,
I will walk before the LORD in the land of the living.
I believed, therefore I said,
I said in my haste,
What will I give to the LORD for all his benefits towards me?
I will take the cup of salvation, and call on the LORD’s name.
I will pay my vows to the LORD,
Precious in the LORD’s sight is the death of his saints.
LORD, truly I am your servant.
I will offer to you the sacrifice of thanksgiving,
I will pay my vows to the LORD,
in the courts of the LORD’s house,
Praise the LORD, all you nations!
For his loving kindness is great towards us.
Give thanks to the LORD, for he is good,
Let Israel now say
Let the house of Aaron now say
Now let those who fear the LORD say
Out of my distress, I called on the LORD.
The LORD is on my side. I will not be afraid.
The LORD is on my side amongst those who help me.
It is better to take refuge in the LORD,
It is better to take refuge in the LORD,
All the nations surrounded me,
They surrounded me, yes, they surrounded me.
They surrounded me like bees.
You pushed me back hard, to make me fall,
The LORD is my strength and song.
The voice of rejoicing and salvation is in the tents of the righteous.
The right hand of the LORD is exalted!
I will not die, but live,
The LORD has punished me severely,
Open to me the gates of righteousness.
This is the gate of the LORD;
I will give thanks to you, for you have answered me,
The stone which the builders rejected
This is the LORD’s doing.
This is the day that the LORD has made.
Save us now, we beg you, LORD!
Blessed is he who comes in the LORD’s name!
The LORD is God, and he has given us light.
You are my God, and I will give thanks to you.
Oh give thanks to the LORD, for he is good,
Blessed are those whose ways are blameless,
Blessed are those who keep his statutes,
Yes, they do nothing wrong.
You have commanded your precepts,
Oh that my ways were steadfast
Then I wouldn’t be disappointed,
I will give thanks to you with uprightness of heart,
I will observe your statutes.
How can a young man keep his way pure?
With my whole heart I have sought you.
I have hidden your word in my heart,
Blessed are you, LORD.
With my lips,
I have rejoiced in the way of your testimonies,
I will meditate on your precepts,
I will delight myself in your statutes.
Do good to your servant.
Open my eyes,
I am a stranger on the earth.
My soul is consumed with longing for your ordinances at all times.
You have rebuked the proud who are cursed,
Take reproach and contempt away from me,
Though princes sit and slander me,
Indeed your statutes are my delight,
My soul is laid low in the dust.
I declared my ways, and you answered me.
Let me understand the teaching of your precepts!
My soul is weary with sorrow;
Keep me from the way of deceit.
I have chosen the way of truth.
I cling to your statutes, LORD.
I run in the path of your commandments,
Teach me, LORD, the way of your statutes.
Give me understanding, and I will keep your law.
Direct me in the path of your commandments,
Turn my heart towards your statutes,
Turn my eyes away from looking at worthless things.
Fulfil your promise to your servant,
Take away my disgrace that I dread,
Behold, I long for your precepts!
Let your loving kindness also come to me, LORD,
So I will have an answer for him who reproaches me,
Don’t snatch the word of truth out of my mouth,
So I will obey your law continually,
I will walk in liberty,
I will also speak of your statutes before kings,
I will delight myself in your commandments,
I reach out my hands for your commandments, which I love.
Remember your word to your servant,
This is my comfort in my affliction,
The arrogant mock me excessively,
I remember your ordinances of old, LORD,
Indignation has taken hold on me,
Your statutes have been my songs
I have remembered your name, LORD, in the night,
This is my way,
The LORD is my portion.
I sought your favour with my whole heart.
I considered my ways,
I will hurry, and not delay,
The ropes of the wicked bind me,
At midnight I will rise to give thanks to you,
I am a friend of all those who fear you,
The earth is full of your loving kindness, LORD.
You have treated your servant well,
Teach me good judgement and knowledge,
Before I was afflicted, I went astray;
You are good, and do good.
The proud have smeared a lie upon me.
Their heart is as callous as the fat,
It is good for me that I have been afflicted,
The law of your mouth is better to me than thousands of pieces of gold and silver.
Your hands have made me and formed me.
Those who fear you will see me and be glad,
LORD, I know that your judgements are righteous,
Please let your loving kindness be for my comfort,
Let your tender mercies come to me, that I may live;
Let the proud be disappointed, for they have overthrown me wrongfully.
Let those who fear you turn to me.
Let my heart be blameless towards your decrees,
My soul faints for your salvation.
My eyes fail for your word.
For I have become like a wineskin in the smoke.
How many are the days of your servant?
The proud have dug pits for me,
All of your commandments are faithful.
They had almost wiped me from the earth,
Preserve my life according to your loving kindness,
LORD, your word is settled in heaven forever.
Your faithfulness is to all generations.
Your laws remain to this day,
Unless your law had been my delight,
I will never forget your precepts,
I am yours.
The wicked have waited for me, to destroy me.
I have seen a limit to all perfection,
How I love your law!
Your commandments make me wiser than my enemies,
I have more understanding than all my teachers,
I understand more than the aged,
I have kept my feet from every evil way,
I have not turned away from your ordinances,
How sweet are your promises to my taste,
Through your precepts, I get understanding;
Your word is a lamp to my feet,
I have sworn, and have confirmed it,
I am afflicted very much.
Accept, I beg you, the willing offerings of my mouth.
My soul is continually in my hand,
The wicked have laid a snare for me,
I have taken your testimonies as a heritage forever,
I have set my heart to perform your statutes forever,
I hate double-minded men,
You are my hiding place and my shield.
Depart from me, you evildoers,
Uphold me according to your word, that I may live.
Hold me up, and I will be safe,
You reject all those who stray from your statutes,
You put away all the wicked of the earth like dross.
My flesh trembles for fear of you.
I have done what is just and righteous.
Ensure your servant’s well-being.
My eyes fail looking for your salvation,
Deal with your servant according to your loving kindness.
I am your servant. Give me understanding,
It is time to act, LORD,
Therefore I love your commandments more than gold,
Therefore I consider all of your precepts to be right.
Your testimonies are wonderful,
The entrance of your words gives light.
I opened my mouth wide and panted,
Turn to me, and have mercy on me,
Establish my footsteps in your word.
Redeem me from the oppression of man,
Make your face shine on your servant.
Streams of tears run down my eyes,
You are righteous, LORD.
You have commanded your statutes in righteousness.
My zeal wears me out,
Your promises have been thoroughly tested,
I am small and despised.
Your righteousness is an everlasting righteousness.
Trouble and anguish have taken hold of me.
Your testimonies are righteous forever.
I have called with my whole heart.
I have called to you. Save me!
I rise before dawn and cry for help.
My eyes stay open through the night watches,
Hear my voice according to your loving kindness.
They draw near who follow after wickedness.
You are near, LORD.
Of old I have known from your testimonies,
Consider my affliction, and deliver me,
Plead my cause, and redeem me!
Salvation is far from the wicked,
Great are your tender mercies, LORD.
Many are my persecutors and my adversaries.
I look at the faithless with loathing,
Consider how I love your precepts.
All of your words are truth.
Princes have persecuted me without a cause,
I rejoice at your word,
I hate and abhor falsehood.
Seven times a day, I praise you,
Those who love your law have great peace.
I have hoped for your salvation, LORD.
My soul has observed your testimonies.
I have obeyed your precepts and your testimonies,
Let my cry come before you, LORD.
Let my supplication come before you.
Let my lips utter praise,
Let my tongue sing of your word,
Let your hand be ready to help me,
I have longed for your salvation, LORD.
Let my soul live, that I may praise you.
I have gone astray like a lost sheep.

chapters.superscription: TAV

verses.text: In my distress, I cried to the LORD.
Deliver my soul, LORD, from lying lips,
What will be given to you, and what will be done more to you,
Sharp arrows of the mighty,
Woe is me, that I live in Meshech,
My soul has had her dwelling too long
I am for peace,

chapters.superscription: A Song of Ascents.

verses.text: I will lift up my eyes to the hills.
My help comes from the LORD,
He will not allow your foot to be moved.
Behold, he who keeps Israel
The LORD is your keeper.
The sun will not harm you by day,
The LORD will keep you from all evil.
The LORD will keep your going out and your coming in,

chapters.superscription: A Song of Ascents.

verses.text: I was glad when they said to me,
Our feet are standing within your gates, Jerusalem!
Jerusalem is built as a city that is compact together,
where the tribes go up, even the LORD’s tribes,
For there are set thrones for judgement,
Pray for the peace of Jerusalem.
Peace be within your walls,
For my brothers’ and companions’ sakes,
For the sake of the house of the LORD our God,

chapters.superscription: A Song of Ascents. By David.

verses.text: I lift up my eyes to you,
Behold, as the eyes of servants look to the hand of their master,
Have mercy on us, LORD, have mercy on us,
Our soul is exceedingly filled with the scoffing of those who are at ease,

chapters.superscription: A Song of Ascents.

verses.text: If it had not been the LORD who was on our side,
if it had not been the LORD who was on our side,
then they would have swallowed us up alive,
then the waters would have overwhelmed us,
Then the proud waters would have gone over our soul.
Blessed be the LORD,
Our soul has escaped like a bird out of the fowler’s snare.
Our help is in the LORD’s name,

chapters.superscription: A Song of Ascents. By David.

verses.text: Those who trust in the LORD are as Mount Zion,
As the mountains surround Jerusalem,
For the sceptre of wickedness won’t remain over the allotment of the righteous,
Do good, LORD, to those who are good,
But as for those who turn away to their crooked ways,

chapters.superscription: A Song of Ascents.

verses.text: When the LORD brought back those who returned to Zion,
Then our mouth was filled with laughter,
The LORD has done great things for us,
Restore our fortunes again, LORD,
Those who sow in tears will reap in joy.
He who goes out weeping, carrying seed for sowing,

chapters.superscription: A Song of Ascents.

verses.text: Unless the LORD builds the house,
It is vain for you to rise up early,
Behold, children are a heritage of the LORD.
As arrows in the hand of a mighty man,
Happy is the man who has his quiver full of them.

chapters.superscription: A Song of Ascents. By Solomon.

verses.text: Blessed is everyone who fears the LORD,
For you will eat the labour of your hands.
Your wife will be as a fruitful vine in the innermost parts of your house,
Behold, this is how the man who fears the LORD is blessed.
May the LORD bless you out of Zion,
Yes, may you see your children’s children.

chapters.superscription: A Song of Ascents.

verses.text: Many times they have afflicted me from my youth up.
many times they have afflicted me from my youth up,
The ploughers ploughed on my back.
The LORD is righteous.
Let them be disappointed and turned backward,
Let them be as the grass on the housetops,
with which the reaper doesn’t fill his hand,
Neither do those who go by say,

chapters.superscription: A Song of Ascents.

verses.text: Out of the depths I have cried to you, LORD.
Lord, hear my voice.
If you, LORD, kept a record of sins,
But there is forgiveness with you,
I wait for the LORD.
My soul longs for the Lord more than watchmen long for the morning,
Israel, hope in the LORD,
He will redeem Israel from all their sins.

chapters.superscription: A Song of Ascents.

verses.text: LORD, my heart isn’t arrogant, nor my eyes lofty;
Surely I have stilled and quieted my soul,
Israel, hope in the LORD,

chapters.superscription: A Song of Ascents. By David.

verses.text: LORD, remember David and all his affliction,
how he swore to the LORD,
“Surely I will not come into the structure of my house,
I will not give sleep to my eyes,
until I find out a place for the LORD,
Behold, we heard of it in Ephrathah.
“We will go into his dwelling place.
Arise, LORD, into your resting place,
Let your priests be clothed with righteousness.
For your servant David’s sake,
The LORD has sworn to David in truth.
If your children will keep my covenant,
For the LORD has chosen Zion.
“This is my resting place forever.
I will abundantly bless her provision.
I will also clothe her priests with salvation.
I will make the horn of David to bud there.
I will clothe his enemies with shame,

chapters.superscription: A Song of Ascents.

verses.text: See how good and how pleasant it is
It is like the precious oil on the head,
like the dew of Hermon,

chapters.superscription: A Song of Ascents. By David.

verses.text: Look! Praise the LORD, all you servants of the LORD,
Lift up your hands in the sanctuary.
May the LORD bless you from Zion,

chapters.superscription: A Song of Ascents.

verses.text: Praise the LORD!
you who stand in the LORD’s house,
Praise the LORD, for the LORD is good.
For the LORD has chosen Jacob for himself,
For I know that the LORD is great,
Whatever the LORD pleased, that he has done,
He causes the clouds to rise from the ends of the earth.
He struck the firstborn of Egypt,
He sent signs and wonders into the middle of you, Egypt,
He struck many nations,
Sihon king of the Amorites,
and gave their land for a heritage,
Your name, LORD, endures forever;
For the LORD will judge his people
The idols of the nations are silver and gold,
They have mouths, but they can’t speak.
They have ears, but they can’t hear,
Those who make them will be like them,
House of Israel, praise the LORD!
House of Levi, praise the LORD!
Blessed be the LORD from Zion,
Give thanks to the LORD, for he is good,
Give thanks to the God of gods,
Give thanks to the Lord of lords,
to him who alone does great wonders,
to him who by understanding made the heavens,
to him who spread out the earth above the waters,
to him who made the great lights,
the sun to rule by day,
the moon and stars to rule by night,
to him who struck down the Egyptian firstborn,
and brought out Israel from amongst them,
with a strong hand, and with an outstretched arm,
to him who divided the Red Sea apart,
and made Israel to pass through the middle of it,
but overthrew Pharaoh and his army in the Red Sea,
to him who led his people through the wilderness,
to him who struck great kings,
and killed mighty kings,
Sihon king of the Amorites,
Og king of Bashan,
and gave their land as an inheritance,
even a heritage to Israel his servant,
who remembered us in our low estate,
and has delivered us from our adversaries,
who gives food to every creature,
Oh give thanks to the God of heaven,
By the rivers of Babylon, there we sat down.
On the willows in that land,
For there, those who led us captive asked us for songs.
How can we sing the LORD’s song in a foreign land?
If I forget you, Jerusalem,
Let my tongue stick to the roof of my mouth if I don’t remember you,
Remember, LORD, against the children of Edom in the day of Jerusalem,
Daughter of Babylon, doomed to destruction,
Happy shall he be,
I will give you thanks with my whole heart.
I will bow down towards your holy temple,
In the day that I called, you answered me.
All the kings of the earth will give you thanks, LORD,
Yes, they will sing of the ways of the LORD,
For though the LORD is high, yet he looks after the lowly;
Though I walk in the middle of trouble, you will revive me.
The LORD will fulfil that which concerns me.

chapters.superscription: By David.

verses.text: LORD, you have searched me,
You know my sitting down and my rising up.
You search out my path and my lying down,
For there is not a word on my tongue,
You hem me in behind and before.
This knowledge is beyond me.
Where could I go from your Spirit?
If I ascend up into heaven, you are there.
If I take the wings of the dawn,
even there your hand will lead me,
If I say, “Surely the darkness will overwhelm me.
even the darkness doesn’t hide from you,
For you formed my inmost being.
I will give thanks to you,
My frame wasn’t hidden from you,
Your eyes saw my body.
How precious to me are your thoughts, God!
If I would count them, they are more in number than the sand.
If only you, God, would kill the wicked.
For they speak against you wickedly.
LORD, don’t I hate those who hate you?
I hate them with perfect hatred.
Search me, God, and know my heart.
See if there is any wicked way in me,

chapters.superscription: For the Chief Musician. A Psalm by David.

verses.text: Deliver me, LORD, from evil men.
those who devise mischief in their hearts.
They have sharpened their tongues like a serpent.
LORD, keep me from the hands of the wicked.
The proud have hidden a snare for me,
I said to the LORD, “You are my God.”
LORD, the Lord, the strength of my salvation,
LORD, don’t grant the desires of the wicked.
As for the head of those who surround me,
Let burning coals fall on them.
An evil speaker won’t be established in the earth.
I know that the LORD will maintain the cause of the afflicted,
Surely the righteous will give thanks to your name.

chapters.superscription: For the Chief Musician. A Psalm by David.

verses.text: LORD, I have called on you.
Let my prayer be set before you like incense;
Set a watch, LORD, before my mouth.
Don’t incline my heart to any evil thing,
Let the righteous strike me, it is kindness;
Their judges are thrown down by the sides of the rock.
“As when one ploughs and breaks up the earth,
For my eyes are on you, LORD, the Lord.
Keep me from the snare which they have laid for me,
Let the wicked fall together into their own nets

chapters.superscription: A Psalm by David.

verses.text: I cry with my voice to the LORD.
I pour out my complaint before him.
When my spirit was overwhelmed within me,
Look on my right, and see;
I cried to you, LORD.
Listen to my cry,
Bring my soul out of prison,

chapters.superscription: A contemplation by David, when he was in the cave. A Prayer.

verses.text: Hear my prayer, LORD.
Don’t enter into judgement with your servant,
For the enemy pursues my soul.
Therefore my spirit is overwhelmed within me.
I remember the days of old.
I spread out my hands to you.
Hurry to answer me, LORD.
Cause me to hear your loving kindness in the morning,
Deliver me, LORD, from my enemies.
Teach me to do your will,
Revive me, LORD, for your name’s sake.
In your loving kindness, cut off my enemies,

chapters.superscription: A Psalm by David.

verses.text: Blessed be the LORD, my rock,
my loving kindness, my fortress,
LORD, what is man, that you care for him?
Man is like a breath.
Part your heavens, LORD, and come down.
Throw out lightning, and scatter them.
Stretch out your hand from above,
whose mouths speak deceit,
I will sing a new song to you, God.
You are he who gives salvation to kings,
Rescue me, and deliver me out of the hands of foreigners,
Then our sons will be like well-nurtured plants,
Our barns are full, filled with all kinds of provision.
Our oxen will pull heavy loads.
Happy are the people who are in such a situation.

chapters.superscription: By David.

verses.text: I will exalt you, my God, the King.
Every day I will praise you.
Great is the LORD, and greatly to be praised!
One generation will commend your works to another,
I will meditate on the glorious majesty of your honour,
Men will speak of the might of your awesome acts.
They will utter the memory of your great goodness,
The LORD is gracious, merciful,
The LORD is good to all.
All your works will give thanks to you, LORD.
They will speak of the glory of your kingdom,
to make known to the sons of men his mighty acts,
Your kingdom is an everlasting kingdom.
The LORD upholds all who fall,
The eyes of all wait for you.
You open your hand,
The LORD is righteous in all his ways,
The LORD is near to all those who call on him,
He will fulfil the desire of those who fear him.
The LORD preserves all those who love him,
My mouth will speak the praise of the LORD.

chapters.superscription: A praise psalm by David.

verses.text: Praise the LORD!
While I live, I will praise the LORD.
Don’t put your trust in princes,
His spirit departs, and he returns to the earth.
Happy is he who has the God of Jacob for his help,
who made heaven and earth,
who executes justice for the oppressed;
The LORD opens the eyes of the blind.
The LORD preserves the foreigners.
The LORD will reign forever;
Praise the LORD,
The LORD builds up Jerusalem.
He heals the broken in heart,
He counts the number of the stars.
Great is our Lord, and mighty in power.
The LORD upholds the humble.
Sing to the LORD with thanksgiving.
who covers the sky with clouds,
He provides food for the livestock,
He doesn’t delight in the strength of the horse.
The LORD takes pleasure in those who fear him,
Praise the LORD, Jerusalem!
For he has strengthened the bars of your gates.
He makes peace in your borders.
He sends out his commandment to the earth.
He gives snow like wool,
He hurls down his hail like pebbles.
He sends out his word, and melts them.
He shows his word to Jacob,
He has not done this for just any nation.
Praise the LORD!
Praise him, all his angels!
Praise him, sun and moon!
Praise him, you heavens of heavens,
Let them praise the LORD’s name,
He has also established them forever and ever.
Praise the LORD from the earth,
lightning and hail, snow and clouds,
mountains and all hills,
wild animals and all livestock,
kings of the earth and all peoples,
both young men and maidens,
Let them praise the LORD’s name,
He has lifted up the horn of his people,
Praise the LORD!
Let Israel rejoice in him who made them.
Let them praise his name in the dance!
For the LORD takes pleasure in his people.
Let the saints rejoice in honour.
May the high praises of God be in their mouths,
to execute vengeance on the nations,
to bind their kings with chains,
to execute on them the written judgement.
Praise the LORD!
Praise him for his mighty acts!
Praise him with the sounding of the trumpet!
Praise him with tambourine and dancing!
Praise him with loud cymbals!
Let everything that has breath praise the LORD!
